title: Suggestion for the Honor System
body:
The voting screen should show k/d/a and maybe even creep score.

Been playing support Brand, and when I win, I have pretty much hard carried most of the games.  I have gotten 0 honors from my teammates in spite of often having most dmg, most kills, and by far most kill contribution.  People should be reminded of who put the work in when considering who to honor.  

Just a thought, considering the trend I've been experiencing.

replies.body: There's a reason none of the honor options mention your performance in the game stats wise: it's because honor is about being friendly, fun, inspirational, and cool under stress. It's not about giving the guy who hard carried an extra pat on the back, it's about recognizing the players on your team who made then game funner, less stressful, and all around worked to counter the standard levels of toxicity that tend to exist in most league matches.

Since you're here... any chance you know if this guy is hacked?

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/riot-official/q5LdBeaT-pax-twisted-fate-coming-back-to-league-store

You nailed it. 
When I tried out Overwatch I really liked the honor system there, but while it has similarities to what Riot developed for LoL, it has that one big difference: you are not honored for being a good player, but for being a good person. It's subtle, but very, *very* different

Vision score too.

People will say it isn't about who plays best, but that definitely factors into most decisions.

I guess you are just an angry tween that needs to be a prick on the internet to compensate for your own shortcomings... good luck with that in life.

If you really want to use k/d/a and cs as a factor in your voting, you can just watch the scoreboard in game.  Honor is likely before EoG with the specific purpose of preventing people from using statistics to bias their vote.
